programme.desc: A UFO spotted over one of the world's holiest sites; a mysterious floating spaceman in a famous photograph; superhumans who can stop cars barehanded.

programme.title: The UnXplained

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Whether surviving freezing temperatures, diving unfathomable depths in one breath, or lifting weighty objects, superhuman feats never cease to amaze; pulling them off could be a matter of training, willpower, genetics, or something more mysterious.

programme.desc: The U.S. military denies that the 1947 Roswell crash involved anything other than a weather balloon, but theorists claim that other UFO crashes were reported all over the world at the same time as the crash and that the wreckages were retrieved.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Erich von Däniken's "Chariots of the Gods?" suggests that aliens visited Earth in the distant past, and there are those who believe that he will be proven right.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Researchers ask if Cloud computing represents the rediscovery of an ancient repository of knowledge known as the Akashic Record; neuroscientist Dr. Dario Nardi measures the brainwaves of Dr. Deepak Chopra as he enters a state of deep meditation.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: People on every continent have claimed to see Bigfoot's footprints. And ancient myths and legends speak of an ape-like giant stalking the earth. What if, as Ancient Astronaut theorists believe, there is evidence to connect Bigfoot with an alien species?

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: In this episode we'll examine the life cycle of a butterfly and delve into the mechanics of how a bird is able to take flight. Plus, the mystery of how a Venus Flytrap catches its prey is revealed.

programme.title: Xploration: Animal Science
programme.desc: In this episode, we find out how the Jaguar's spots create a disruptive pattern that makes them harder for prey to see. We'll also learn how a bee sting really works, and how a salmon is able to migrate thousands of miles to spawn.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: This week we will be looking at a fascinating subject that most of us take for granted. To do so, I'll be hiking through forests, kayaking on lakes, and even venturing through scientific laboratories, all to explore the Amazing World of Plants.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Our planet is a land of extremes, from raging forest fires, to frigid fields of ice. Join Philippe Cousteau as we explore nature's power of Fire and Ice, here on Awesome Planet.

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: In this episode, we examine the science of the cat. We'll learn about the evolution of cats throughout the world, featuring the Saber-tooth Tiger. Find out how cat senses stack up against other animals. Also, how will you do on our feline pop quiz?

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: Prairie dogs have their own language and one of the most complex communications in the animal kingdom. Plus an owls hearing can pick up a heartbeat over 100 feet away. And leaf cutter ants slice through foliage with jaws that vibrate 1000 times/second!

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Fitment issues in the engine bay leave the entire shop scratching their heads; Joe has big plans for the '65 Nova, but a small space to work with.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A customer wants to surprise his wife with major upgrades to her '68 Corvette convertible, but working with the fiberglass body soon brings on headaches that threaten both the car and the shop to crack under the pressure.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: The clock is ticking to complete a 1968 Corvette convertible, but messy fiberglass repairs uncover major collision damage; and if that wasn't enough, the customer also wants an all-white interior, which isn't a good fit for such a dirty job.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A time capsule rolls into the shop in the form of a 1983 Silverado with exactly 69.2 miles on it; the owner recently passed away, and his daughter wants to finish turning his truck into a modern muscle car under the hood.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Amanda and Shag stumble upon a '73 Vega with a rich history and a seller anxious to see his car restored to glory; they plan to chop the top and add a enormous engine, but first they must tackle over 40 years of rust and grime.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe Martin brings new life to old iron at his shop Joe Martin Customs; working with his wife Amanda, and best friend Shag, this custom shop oversees every phase of restoration from design, fabrication and mechanicals, to the final paint job.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A '57 Chevy looks great, but the guys discover that looks can be deceiving.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe Martin puts the finishing touches on the 1957 Chevrolet Bel Air and arranges for the car to be delivered to the owner; Joe uses all his tricks to prepare a Chevrolet C10 for a charity auction with a stylish paint job.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe and the team finish up the '51 Chevy 3100 Christmas-parade truck.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe and the team finish up the '51 Chevy 3100 Christmas-parade truck.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe dusts off his prized '65 Pontiac Catalina to give it the facelift it deserves -- new brakes, new trick frame and a bigger, badder LSA 600 horsepower motor. Meanwhile, Martin Bros. Customs tricks out the interior on an iconic 1932 Ford Roadster.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: With updates well underway on custom car guru Joe Martin's prized '65 Pontiac Catalina, Joe and the boys at Martin Bros. Customs give the ol' choppy-doo to a '41 DeSoto that has seen better days.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A longtime customer has his eye set on a car from Joe's personal collection, a 1967 Nova; Joe counters by offering up a 1966 Nova, with the guarantee that it will be twice the car Joe's is; big brakes, big power, big wheels and more.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe pulls out all the stops to make the '66 Nova the car of his client's dreams; Joe doesn't just want a mean motor and big tires; he wants a chopped roof, but the car might be too far behind schedule for a chop, even if it does up the cool factor.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A customer from New York entrusts Joe with his prized 1965 Buick Riviera.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe and the crew button up the 1965 Riviera's wiring, interior and paint.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The biggest No-Limit Hold'em buy-in of the 2004 WSOP outside of the Main Event would attract 254 entrants and create a prize pool of $1,193,800. Barry Greenstein and Dewey Tomko fell short of reaching the final table, as WSOP veterans James Sousa and Paul "Eskimo" Clark headlined the final table ahead of Lee Watkinson, Thomas Keller, Martin de Knijff, and Young Phan as they chased the $382,020 first-place prize.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Halloween, the favorite time of year for the Conners, but an email from the school banning certain costumes, including Mark's, sets off an argument between Dan and Darlene.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Geena learns D.J. hasn't been taking Mary to church while she's been away, so she insists they go as a family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A family member drops a life-changing announcement; Dan suspects that Becky isn't sticking to her end of the deal about her drinking; Darlene continues her job search.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: With Mark and Mary's help, Jackie convinces Dan to build a chicken coop so the family can eat organic eggs.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan questions Peter's motives when he learns about the pricey Christmas gift Jackie bought for her new unemployed beau. Elsewhere, Mark and Mary write up their Christmas wish list.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Becky helps Harris keep a secret from Darlene, it causes a split between the two sisters.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Dan gets injured on the job covering D.J.'s vending machine route, the choice to sue the company could lead to D.J. getting fired.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Ben offers Mark free piano lessons, Darlene finds this as an opportunity to test his parenting skills. Meanwhile, Jackie throws Becky a baby shower.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Darlene grapples with a life-altering offer, a conversation with David turns her world more upside-down.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: After Emilio's deportation, Jackie takes on a paternal role crafting a birth plan for Becky; Darlene navigates a love triangle with David and Ben; Harris faces her own dilemma.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene struggles to decide between David and Ben; Becky begins to doubt herself as a mom; Mark gets in trouble at school when a picture of him and his boyfriend kissing goes viral

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris confronts Darlene's lifestyle; Jackie meddles in others' affairs to evade her own issues; Becky struggles with the expenses of parenthood, her family lends support.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky applies for a bartending job at Casita Bonita; Dan is concerned it could worsen her drinking.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: At Halloween, Jackie learns a shocking secret while trying to reopen the Lunch Box.

programme.desc: Jackie and Becky pitch their business plan to Darlene in hopes of getting the Lunch Box back, but Darlene's decision leads to hostility among the three.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Thanksgiving chaos erupts as Dan gathers the family; tensions rise over the Lunch Box; Harris surprises everyone with a bold move.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie’s faced with a tough decision that brings the family and community together.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan is disappointed when everyone but Becky forgets about his birthday; Darlene faces another issue; Dan excludes Jackie from the family Christmas Santa photo for mistreating Louis

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners resist Becky's Packers fan boyfriend; Dan emphasizes family loyalty to the Bears to Mark; Ben and Darlene seek a loan for their magazine.

programme.desc: Darlene’s thrilled when Harris gets into Central Illinois State, but she may have other plans.

programme.desc: The Conners debate voting reasons; Louise's offer threatens to take her from Lanford, prompting family intervention in Dan's relationship.

programme.desc: Dan avoids grief until it confronts him; Ben and Darlene tackle baby fever; Dwight's nervous to fill in for an injured chef.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan connects with his half-brother but struggles with their father's unequal treatment; Jackie hits it off with a fun married couple.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene joins Price Warehouse for income; Jackie advances her relationship with Ron and Janelle; Ben alters his appearance for advertisers.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris returns home newly-unemployed; Becky seeks childcare; Jackie advises reaching out to Emilio's family; the family ponders tattoos.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Bev returns, wants to spread happiness with her money. She offers to fund Mark's coding camp tuition, but Darlene suggests giving it to Harris.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan’s ready to share his feelings with Louise; Darlene realizes how badly she wants a baby.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan and Louise deepen their bond amid the challenges of aging; Darlene's night in jail leaves Ben in charge of parenting; Mark's class experiment with a friend results in hickeys.

programme.desc: Darlene and Ben hunt for apartments; Jackie, Becky, and Beverly Rose road trip to Mexico to meet her father; Dan confides financial woes to Louise.

programme.desc: Harris's job is in jeopardy after joining a protest she strongly believes in, leading to tense discussions within the family.

programme.desc: Darlene earns a promotion at Wellman Plastics, while Ben decides on a new career path; Jackie tries an herbal tea. and it leads to an emotional revelation.

programme.desc: Chuck's new purchase of a boat creates a rift; Darlene hires her first assistant at Wellman's Plastics but soon realizes she is anything but helpful.

programme.desc: Mark is convinced he has COVID-19; Becky and Harris team up to confront Josh, who has been 'ghosting' Harris.

programme.desc: Dan feels helpless when Louise refuses to let him put himself at risk for her; when Jackie learns the competing restaurants are posting negative reviews.

programme.desc: Becky meets up with an old friend and feels pressured to impress him; Dan questions his position at the hardware store, leading to a massive fight between him and Ben.

programme.desc: Darlene makes a decision about her trip to Hawaii, leading to a heated encounter with Barb; Becky gives a presentation on addiction to Mark's class.

programme.desc: Two proposals bring big changes to the Conner family; Jackie uses her Jeopardy infamy to her advantage.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners continue to deal with the pandemic while navigating breakups and newfound sobriety, all while planning an upcoming wedding.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: After Ben declines Darlene's proposal, she starts to ponder why she tends to be so negative in life, prompting her to start a journey of self-discovery, which leads to Pastor Phil.

programme.desc: Part of Becky's recovery program mandates she make amends with people she has lied to over the years, leading her to meet up again with a former high school friend.

programme.desc: It's Dan and Louise's wedding day, but it's a far-from-perfect, especially when a weather report forecasts that a tornado is headed for Lanford creating chaos and surprises.

programme.desc: Darlene worries about Mark making friends at his new school; Mark turns to Ben for advice; Becky finds herself thriving in college and starts thinking about her future plans.

programme.desc: Sparks fly between a famous model and a farmer with a young daughter when she visits her childhood home for the holidays.

programme.desc: With their family bakery facing foreclosure before the holidays, two rival sisters must put their differences aside to win a TV baking competition.

programme.title: A Miracle on Christmas Lake
programme.desc: After suffering the loss of his best friend Charlie on Christmas Eve, sixteen year old Bobby Whiteside ventures out onto the lake where they played countless games of winter hockey. Upon shoveling the ice surface he makes a shocking discovery --- a magic, perfectly groomed hockey rink that appears only at night and only in his presence. When a local construction company purchases the land for development, Bobby must join forces with his high school crush, rally the town, and play one last game on the night pond --- with an old friend.

programme.desc: After suffering the loss of his best friend Charlie on Christmas Eve, sixteen year old Bobby Whiteside ventures out onto the lake where they played countless games of winter hockey. Upon shoveling the ice surface he makes a shocking discovery --- a magic, perfectly groomed hockey rink that appears only at night and only in his presence. When a local construction company purchases the land for development, Bobby must join forces with his high school crush, rally the town, and play one last game on the night pond --- with an old friend.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This is the last episode of the season and the 8 previous winners compete to be the Champion of Champions.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: Log Roll, Wall Swing, The Ring, Tippy Tables, and Cylinder Run are among the over-the-top obstacles in this week’s episode.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Richard and Amanda guide 20 foolhardy Brits through the biggest and daftest obstacle course in the universe.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Showdowns don’t come more epic than this. Pro Wrestler Mikey takes on Wipeout Australias very own Tom Cruise. Its neck and neck through the qualifier which this week includes a real Mission Impossible, Dirty Balls. The trash talk is as fierce as the competition and continues to the Wipeout Zone with the winner taking not only the $20,000 but also the glory. Australia is also introduced to a new kind of “violent love”, the Fight Hug.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Mesmerized by Bon Bon’s Belly Dancing, we catch up with our favourite Big Balls in the Qualifier. They dish out punishment to Australia’s very own female Jim Carrey and send Big Cat tamer Robbie into the pond. Goofy Goggles up the ante on the Dreadmill causing the Breakdancing Dad to create hilarious new moves. Golden Guns, Marisa battles it out for the ladies against Perfect Specimen, Seamus in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Richard Hammond presents the annual Total Wipeout trophy-athon.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: Log Roll, Wall Swing, The Ring, Tippy Tables, and Cylinder Run are among the over-the-top obstacles in this week’s episode.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: 10 celebrities will be taking the reindeer-drawn celebrity sleigh to the top of the Qualifier.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Fashion comes to Wipeout Australia as we meet Adam “God’s Gift” Marshall, a self styled Ad man who conquers the Qualifier. Other Catwalk moments include the Grandpa in his Red Speedos and a Rainbow Bright Personal Ad. If jumping a revolving arm while balancing on a pedestal above water isn’t enough for you then you’ll love this weeks Sweeper. Contestants are armed with Dodgeballs, to be deployed at each other, creating horrific hits and spectacular spills. The Dizzy Dummy claims its first victim as Dummy Tummy rejects a contestant and the Wipeout Zone becomes a battle of young and old.

programme.title: 101 Ways to Leave a Gameshow
programme.desc: Steve Jones hosts the series where contestants are ejected in the most nerve-wracking means ever seen on TV.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s Sitcom Central on Wipeout Australia with the Odd Couple, starring World’s Strongest Dwarf, David Clarke and Gentle Giant, Tim Watts. Once again the Big Balls deliver some spectacular moments with an Italian Chef being sliced and diced. Sacks are introduced at the Sweeper proving too much for some, but surprisingly helping the ladies to even things out as we go into a 50/50 male, female split in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Winter Wipeout has the awards show to end all awards shows –The Snow Globes.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: 20 Greatest Hits

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: In this episode, twenty intrepid contestants take on four gruelling obstacles.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Winter Wipeout once again challenges some of the nation's most famous faces to tackle obstacle course.

programme.title: 101 Ways to Leave a Gameshow
programme.desc: More unsuspecting contestants, all competing for a 10k pound prize, are dropped, fired and dragged screaming.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: From singing Pastors to Wookies, this week is jammed pack with Characters, who battle it out on the Qualifier with amusing attempts at the inconceivable Field Goal Swing. Its no easy task to earn a spot in the Wipeout Zone this week with the Dreadmill, sorting the men from the boys. Contestants must dodge the wrecking ball while shooting basketballs. Although there is one man who came prepared, Dodgeball Champion Dan Bennett, whose “Duck, Dive, Dip, Dodge and Dunk” training comes into play.

programme.title: 101 Ways to Leave a Gameshow
programme.desc: Contestants are ejected from the show in the craziest and most outrageous ways possible.

programme.title: Total Wipeout

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: Donut run, ball swing. Sweeper: Dangly balls. Dizzy Dummy: barrel crossing and log roll

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Ordinary British folk fly halfway across the world to test their endurance and bouncability in Argentina.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s no doubt that the ‘Ball Crusher’ Sweeper is the star of tonight’s show. With a brother- sister team hanging by a thread and a three-way hurdle, this week’s Sweeper writes itself into the History books. Tonight is also the night we meet Buffman, a pint sized Superhero with a twitch and a photo finish at the Dizzy Dummy threatens extinction to a Rare Breed. A week of action packed Wipeouts with Latin Dancing lotharios, what more can you ask for? And for the kids, a Fairy Tale, Wipeout Style!

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This time the 'Dodgeball Men' are back to make 'The Qualifier' game an even bigger challenge for contestants.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Wipeout Australia debunks the myth that only young, fit and funky people should go on game shows. This week we are forced to take notice of Demolition Dave, a 49 yr old South Australia man who thanks to some home training smashes the qualifier. For those lucky enough to survive the Fly Screen Sweeper it was Dizzy Dummy time. Emerging as the Dark Horse, Kobie Mulligan earned herself a shot in the Wipeout Zone, joined by a Strategist and Rubber Woman resulting in a bitter showdown.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Twenty foolhardy Brits attempt to conquer the purpose-built obstacle course in Argentina.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada

programme.desc: Richard and co-host Amanda return with new obstacles, new contestants and LOTS of falling in this episode.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: This week contestants on Wipeout Australia are bought undone by a seemingly simple obstacle on the Qualifier, the Slippery Stairs. It’s all in the name really, an innocent set of stairs, covered in Wipeout Crash cream. Its up the way and down the way for all and sundry. The lucky 12 that move through, battle it out with a giant toothbrush Sweeper. ‘Nat with the Tats’ and Renee ‘Lets get physical’ move through to the Dreadmill, flying the banner for the ladies. Look out for Scotty Six Toes at the Big Balls and get the ear plugs ready as you meet Herr Chris. It’s a colourful week with leotards, laughs and lots of ladies.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the Wales regional final as the two remaining chefs do everything they can to impress the judging panel of Andi Oliver, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. After tensions ran high in the week, the chefs are under pressure to deliver perfection. The judges are joined by Aneira Thomas, the first baby born on the NHS, who is named in tribute to the service's founder Aneurin Bevan and who went on to dedicate her life to the service. Who will win a place in the national finals?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the turn of three chefs representing the south west, including two who have competed before but meet in the kitchen this week for the very first time. The chefs meet their surprise veteran judge and cook their celebratory starters.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the fish course and with Tom renowned as a fish specialist all eyes are on him. He's cooking his take on a classic British fish supper in tribute to a charity which looks after the health of local fishermen. Jude is attempting a complex fusion dish featuring four different fish and an unusual X Ray themed presentation, while Olivia is paying tribute to the staff who looked after her during the birth of her first son with her take on curried monkfish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the main course and two of the chefs are hoping duck will win the day. Tom is preparing a technically challenging duck dish steeped in NHS history while Jude is making a multi-element Chinese duck dish inspired by his mum. Olivia is hoping her dish, using two unusual cuts of beef, will score top points. Olivia also visits her local children's hospital, home of the second busiest paediatric A&E in the country.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With just one more chance to impress their veteran judge, the chefs are all hoping to use their pastry skills to deliver technically complex desserts. Tom's cooking an `Invalid Fruit Tart' inspired by a 1950s recipe, while Jude is making six different apple elements for his `An Apple A Day'. Olivia is using stout in reference to an outdated old wives' tale which suggested the drink was a healthy source of iron during pregnancy.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's time for the two remaining chefs representing the South West to go head to head as they cook their menus again for the exacting panel of Andi Oliver, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. With a spot in the National Finals at stake, both are aiming for perfection as they bid for glory. The judges are joined by Barbara Childs, a Matron in the Cardiac Intensive Care Unit at Great Ormond Street Hospital, who isn't afraid to speak her mind in the chamber.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three chefs take to the kitchen in a bid to represent the north west in the national final. They include Ellis Barrie, from the award winning Marram Grass in Anglesey, Liam Simpson-Trotman, an accomplished pastry chef and co-owner of the 4 AA rosette Orwell's in Oxfordshire, and Craig Sherrington, who sharpened his skills working under top names including Eric Chavot and is now Chef Patron of Virginia House in Cumbria.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the fish course and the chefs are all gunning for tens. Craig pays tribute to a friend who has revolutionised hospital food in Morecambe Bay, while Liam is inspired by health advice his grandma gave him and Ellis is dedicating his dish to the staff who delivered his son Albert. With cod, mackerel, shrimp and cockles on the menu, which of the chefs will score highly?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Time for the chefs to cook their mains and the pressure is on. Craig is hoping to impress using two cuts of Dexter beef, while Liam prepares his take on a Bajan lamb stew and Ellis prepares four cuts of suckling pig. Liam meets his personal hero, Nola Ishmael OBE, who became the UK's first ever black Director of Nursing.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the dessert course and the last chance for the North West chefs to impress in a bid to make it through to the regional final. Liam is cooking `Not So Hot Toddy' in honour of a friend who works nightshifts in the NHS, while Ellis' `Worth Their Weight in Gold' is dedicated to the staff who saved his brother's life and Craig's dish `The Missed Celebration' pays tribute to his wife with an unusual Christmas concept.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two highest scoring chefs from the week return to cook their menus again. Judging them are Matthew Fort, Oliver Peyton and Andi Oliver who are joined by Dr Jake Dunning MBE, an infectious disease specialist who has been recognised for his work during the West Africa Ebola epidemic.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three chefs are doing battle to represent Northern Ireland. Tommy Heaney, Head Chef at the Great House Hotel in South Wales is taken on by Shauna Froydenlund, Chef Patron at Marcus Wareing's two Michelin starred restaurant and James Devine, the 2017 National Chef of the Year.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: After a tense starter course, the chefs return to the kitchen to cook their fish dishes. James is making his elevated take on a fried chicken takeaway as a tribute to the NHS staff who care for his sister. Shauna is also taking inspiration from a personal connection with a tribute to staff from a facility in her hometown of Londonderry. Tommy is hoping to impress with a dish dedicated to the discovery of DNA.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With two courses down it's time for the chefs to cook their main courses. It's the battle of beef with each using the same meat in their innovative creations. Tommy also meets the first baby ever born on the NHS.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the dessert course and the final chance for the chefs to impress. After such a tightly fought battle all week, each is hoping to deliver a technically perfect dessert. Tommy and James are both using passion fruit in their complex dishes while Shauna is hoping to use her pastry chef training to score full marks.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two chefs representing Northern Ireland go head to head. Judging as ever are Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and Andi Oliver who are joined by Shehan Hettiaratchy, lead trauma surgeon at St Mary's Hospital who helped treat victims of the Grenfell Tower fire.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The winning chefs from all eight regions must battle it out for the honour of a spot on 2018's `Feast To Say Thank You' banquet menu, celebrating 70 years of the NHS, one of Britain's most prized institutions.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs must cook their fish courses but after some exceptionally high-scoring dishes in the starter round, everyone is desperate to deliver perfection. Once again the chefs present their innovative, witty or heart-warming creations.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's main course day and with only two spots remaining on the banquet menu, the competition is fierce. Both chefs and judges alike are amazed at the high standard of cooking and an incredible number of 10s are dished out as the chefs serve up venison, rabbit, duck, beef, lamb and pork for scrutiny.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's dessert day and with just one place remaining at the banquet feast, each chef is giving everything they've got for a chance to say thank you to the heroic NHS staff. All the chefs have significantly re-worked or re-invented their desserts since the regional heats, proving that they'll do everything they can in a bid for that final winning spot.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the grand finale as the winning chefs cook their dishes at a banquet for the heroes of the NHS. Having arrived at St Bartholomew's Hospital, the chefs are shown the incredible location for event, the almost three-hundred-year-old Great Hall.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Andrew Pern, Stephanie Moon and Tim Bilton prepare their starters which include potted venison with watercress and crisp fennel salad, `salmagundi' of North County produce, and sticky pigeon breast, forager's relish, hedgerow and beetroot crisps.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Andrew Pern, Stephanie Moon and Tim Bilton prepare their fish dishes: seafood stew, fish soup with a toasted kipper club sandwich and hot oak smoked Kilnsey trout, golden tea cream and Daleside scraps.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Andrew Pern, Stephanie Moon, and Tim Bilton make haymaker's twice-baked Nidderdale lamb, bluemin white potatoes and gravy, suckling pig with pork pies, black pudding, Scotch eggs and sticky spare ribs, and whole roast stuffed suckling pig.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the chefs from the North East to impress. Tim Bilton, Andrew Pern and Stephanie Moon deliver their desserts which include gooseberry and apple crumble, a celebration of rhubarb and custard and Yorkshire mess.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Only two chefs remain, as they cook their entire menus for judges Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the battle of the Northern Ireland chefs Brian McCann, Chris Bell and Chris Fearon. They kick things off with their starters which include hot and cold meats with pickles, brown bag coronation chicken and a summer picnic.

programme.desc: The judges aren't easily pleased and only first-class cooking will do. Just one chef can make it through to the national finals to represent Northern Ireland and get the chance to cook at the People's Banquet.

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.desc: Monty assesses the progress, successes and failures of his paradise garden. Elsewhere, Frances Tophill travels to Glasgow to meet a gardener whose hands-off approach to his garden has reaped rewards for wildlife.

programme.title: My Dream Farm
programme.desc: Monty visits Nick and Talitha, who hope to make a new life for themselves from two acres of land.

programme.title: My Dream Farm
programme.desc: Monty visits city girl Jen and her country cousin Bek who have started a flower farm in Kent.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty prepares for late spring and summer, while Toby Buckland revels in some spring planting at Melbourne Hall in Derbyshire. Rachel de Thame meets a dahlia grower who once worked at the White House.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill reveals some exciting news. After years of dreaming, she finally has her very own garden and can't wait to share her plans and get to grips with bringing this compact space to life.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill and the team continue to celebrate the joy that the gardening year brings throughout the seasons. Rachel de Thame visits Anglesey Abbey in Cambridgeshire, a garden designed to look its best in winter.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Two gardeners, each living on their own, are hoping Monty can help them. In Blackpool, Alex dreams of turning her boring back yard into a magical enchanted forest. Also in Bristol, Ross has taken on a very over-grown allotment.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Leyton, Tariq and Sairah want to turn their dumping ground of a back yard into a sumptuous award-winning garden, suitable for entertaining friends and family. Both have competitive jobs in the banking sector and are used to winning at work but when it comes to gardening, they don't know where to begin.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: One couple battle to turn a clay-clogged building site in Sussex into a piece of Portugal. Another tackle a forest of overgrowth in their new back garden in Cadeby. They are determined to create a productive space, something they have always wanted.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is busy planting umbellifers and making some changes to the dry garden. He also sows peas and pots on his dahlias. Carol reveals exciting plans for an ambitious show garden she's designing for the RHS Hampton Court Palace Garden Festival.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam visits a walled garden in Somerset to meet a group of volunteers who are gardening alongside those who need help to transform their lives. At Longmeadow, Monty creates two different planting schemes for pots for shady spaces, transplants grasses in the jewel garden, and plants out his favourite varieties of tomatoes.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don uncovers the extraordinary stories behind Britain’s seventeenth century gardens.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: The boys have a full camp for their first bow hunt of the season. With warm Temps and acorns falling everywhere, Nate throws a hail Mary on the last day on a buck they call "The Squiggly 8"

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: It happens, especially once the rut rolls around. A Monster Buck named drops that Tyler Jordan had been hunting all season wonders over to the neighbors and is shot by hunter Wesley Tyus. Check out the story of Drops and how Tyler was able to be there for the recovery of this once in a lifetime buck.

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
programme.desc: Zach heads back to the homeland to chase ducks and geese in the prairie potholes.

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
programme.desc: Cameraman, Kyle gets behind the bow for a couple hunts in Kentucky and connects with his first buck in over 5 years.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Justin Martinovich heads home to his family's cranberry farm in Wisconsin to lend a hand in harvest—and chase after bog-country whitetails with his crossbow.

programme.title: HuntStand TIps and Gear
programme.desc: Join Cody Butler for a deep dive into ground blind strategies for bowhunting turkeys. Discover essential tips and tactics for bagging big toms with your bow from ground blinds. Learn about optimal blind placement for a successful turkey hunt.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield of All Things Hunting and Willi Schmidt of Pure Hunting share their personal stories of how hunting has been an integral part of their lives, passed down through generations. While their beginnings and experiences are very different, they find common ground in the heritage of Browning Firearms with memorable whitetail hunts in Louisiana and Montana.

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: Cliff draws the tag of a lifetime in Iowa, but the hunt doesn’t go as expected. Without his sick friend Stephen, and facing challenges with self-filming, Cliff contemplates giving up. But when he finally takes the biggest buck of his life, he realizes the importance of capturing the moment. Learn from his journey and see why every hunt matters!

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: Christian Hogg of Fiocci ammunition shows what being a modern hunter means to him on his hunt for big whitetails in the Nebraska sandhills.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike Anderson heads down south in search of schooled up redfish.

programme.title: Reel Animals

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh and good friend as well as fellow guide, Josh Nelson hit the beach for some stud Redfish. They also met with Alex Fogg (Coastal resource manager) for a redfish release with the CCA.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh and Alex Fogg The Coastal Resource Manager of Destin / Ft. Walton beach fish some of the artificial reefs that have been deployed over the past 20 years.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh and Anna set out for a last minute fishing trip that runs a little late. They take a quick detour to the parent pick up line to get the kids from school, and head back out on the water to see what’s biting!

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh takes his friend Isaiah to the blue water as they look for destin's latest hot bite, the blackfin tuna.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh and George from Two Georges Marina battle the wind and tide on a tough day of fishing which leads Josh to fish another day, solely for revenge on the Sheepshead!

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Join Captain Josh and Sheriff Eric Aden for a day of fishing and fun in Destin, Florida. These two friends hit the water, catching fish both offshore and inshore, and reeling in some impressive catches. With plenty of laughs, great stories, and a few surprises along the way, this episode is all about the joy of fishing and the bond between two guys who love the sea.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: Cajun classics are met with a Zimbabwean flair in this delicious mashup of cultures. Join Chef Jay Ducote and Food Network Star Rue Lindsay as they take on the fishing village of Cocodrie, Louisiana. Guided by Captain Zach LeBeouf, this tasty adventure will surely leave you hankering for more.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: Join us at Pelican’s Roost in Delacroix, LA, where Captain Sean Thornton and Chef Jay Ducote were able to share the full Louisiana Catch & Cook experience with Texas Food Personality Trey “Chow Down” Chapman—with delicious results.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: Louisiana’s Cajun Ninja joins Chef Jay Ducote in our latest catch-and-cook adventure. Tag along as they hit up the hottest fishing spots in Plaquemines Parish with Captain Shane York and turn their catches into authentic Cajun meals.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: The Duck Camp Dinners crew catches catfish and fries up seafood while they visit neighbors in the swamps before the cook up an iconic Cajun dish.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: The Duck Camp Dinners crew leaves the bayous and heads down river to Venice, Louisiana where they prepare for their first duck hunt in the delta.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: The DCD crew spends a day on the water fishing in an effort to complete the trifecta of a meat haul. Blake shows us where he spent much of his childhood and we get a glimpse of mother natures impact on community.

programme.title: ConQuest 200
programme.desc: Antlers on ConQuest deer farm must be removed to ensure the safety of bucks fighting and killing each other. Watch how Doug Roberts selects only the best typical bucks for his breeding program.

programme.title: ConQuest 200
programme.desc: Doug Roberts takes his knee surgeon hunting at High Rack Ranch of Michigan, from pheasant hunting to big whitetails. Doug Roberts decides to take the advice of his doctor and schedule surgery for his second knee replacement.

programme.title: ConQuest 200
programme.desc: Collecting semen from breeder bucks only happens when Doug has found the perfect typical whitetail. A 7x7 named Bruce, son of Die Hard is being collected.

programme.title: ConQuest 200
programme.desc: Join Doug Roberts as he selects his newest breeder bucks on the deer farm. Cutting antlers and visiting the annual youth buck pole marks the start of hunting season. Special guest Cody Robins from Live 2 Hunt.

programme.title: ConQuest 200
programme.desc: Daily farm activities during the busy season. Main topic VS 1, pullingcedars. Cody Robison's Whitetail Hunt using 10 point and using VS 1

programme.title: ConQuest 200
programme.desc: ConQuest Scents travels to the ATA show and releases their new Heat Seeker product to the public. After ATA they head home to the farm and start building a new addition to the main facility.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip

The brothers spend a day in the boat with Bryant Stark of Rising Rivers, fishing the White and the Norfork. Though the White is much larger waters than back home, Trevor utilizes his experience to catch them even while wading.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: In Episode 10 Boat Trader heads to central Texas to explore boating culture in the lone star state. Second only to Alaska in size, Texas is known as the place where everything is bigger. From big college football games to endless oil fields and vast wind farms, Texas is home to more than 30 million Americans. But the state is about more than just big oil, college football and cattle farms - it's also home to some of the best boating in the country. Boasting a myriad of waterways, boaters here enjoy hundreds of lakes, rivers and streams that provide recreational opportunities, abundant wildlife and plenty of fishing. From Austin Texas to San Antonio host Ryan McVinney and the Boat Trader crew explore the laid-back Texas lake life including boat up restaurants along the Colorado River, watersports in Austin and the history of the waterways throughout the region. Boat manufacturers highlighted in this episode are Tige Boats and ATX Surf Boats, two premium Texas-based wake boat brands known for their high-quality, cutting-edge vessels that come equipped with advanced wake shaping technologies and equipment ideal for water skiing, wake surfing and wakeboarding. There's even a wake surfing dog!

programme.title: Primos
programme.desc: Team Primos chases whitetail deer at our home camp, Kudzu Bluff, on the edge of the MS Delta. The guys also head out to hunt the rut in Iowa with their Mathews bows.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: With so much focus on Chronic Wasting Disease, a more deadly disease is all to often being overlooked while it decimates deer herds across the world, that disease is EHD.

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: In most cases, the cameraman or woman hunts as well… Often their “play time” happens between scheduled season hunts for the show. But why don’t we see those? This year, I made it a point to film all of my camera girl’s hunts and decided to make an episode out of it. Without help, none of this possible! So to all the camera operators, behind the scenes industry folks… Thank you and this is for you!!!

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: In Episode 10 Boat Trader heads to central Texas to explore boating culture in the lone star state. Second only to Alaska in size, Texas is known as the place where everything is bigger. From big college football games to endless oil fields and vast wind farms, Texas is home to more than 30 million Americans. But the state is about more than just big oil, college football and cattle farms - it's also home to some of the best boating in the country. Boasting a myriad of waterways, boaters here enjoy hundreds of lakes, rivers and streams that provide recreational opportunities, abundant wildlife and plenty of fishing. From Austin Texas to San Antonio host Ryan McVinney and the Boat Trader crew explore the laid-back Texas lake life including boat up restaurants along the Colorado River, watersports in Austin and the history of the waterways throughout the region. Boat manufacturers highlighted in this episode are Tige Boats and ATX Surf Boats, two premium Texas-based wake boat brands known for their high-quality, cutting-edge vessels that come equipped with advanced wake shaping technologies and equipment ideal for water skiing, wake surfing and wakeboarding. There's even a wake surfing dog!

programme.title: Primos
programme.desc: Team Primos chases whitetail deer at our home camp, Kudzu Bluff, on the edge of the MS Delta. The guys also head out to hunt the rut in Iowa with their Mathews bows.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: With so much focus on Chronic Wasting Disease, a more deadly disease is all to often being overlooked while it decimates deer herds across the world, that disease is EHD.

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: In most cases, the cameraman or woman hunts as well… Often their “play time” happens between scheduled season hunts for the show. But why don’t we see those? This year, I made it a point to film all of my camera girl’s hunts and decided to make an episode out of it. Without help, none of this possible! So to all the camera operators, behind the scenes industry folks… Thank you and this is for you!!!

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Join Mark Peterson as he ventures into Croatia’s wild heart, hot on the trail of a legendary stag. In the midst of the rutting season’s deafening roars, tensions escalate as Mark closes the distance.Equipped with his Gunwerks 7LRM, things get dicey as Mark is face to face with a roaring stag at 12 yards!

programme.title: AFTCO Original Film
programme.desc: Last August, we partnered with Capt. Moe Newman of Journey South Outfitters to host the AFTCO Women’s Fish Camp in Venice, LA. Nine female ambassadors from various states joined to test our spring women's fishing line, representing both saltwater and freshwater perspectives. The experience shaped the final offerings for this spring and future line plans for our women's fishing clothing.

Her comeback story not unlike something you’d see in a movie…in fact it inspired one. Disabled Outdoorsmen USA contacted TTHA and set up this hunt and we were fortunate enough to be able to capture just some of Amberly’s story and her harvest of a beautiful Axis buck at the G2 Ranch in the spring of 2022.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Realtree's crew of waterfowl hunters get together for their annual Louisiana duck hunt. Dr. Duck, Billy Campbell, Rusty Creasey, and Michael Pitts head down south to get on the ducks. There's a lot of ducks around, but they're playing hard to get. So, the guys have to get creative to make it happen.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: With record low temperatures in the forecast, the Black Cloud crew hits the timber for one last hunt before the freeze. Some days hunting ducks in the Timber is all about your calling and decoy spread... some days you're on the X and none of that matters.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: The Road Trips crew gets one more hunt in before the rain arrives in Georgia. Michael Pitts finally has the right wind to head back into the honey hole. Colton Jordan hunts with his father Bill hoping to lay eyes on a buck they spotted earlier in the year. Tyler Jordan decides to hang and hunt a new spot where a big 9-pointer is showing up.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Tyler Jordan and the Under Taker are hunting cranes down South. Check in to see how the hunt went. It was certainly a waterfowl hunt to remember.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Public competition, little sleep, mother nature, and a wrong turn. It's a rough weekend for the Arkansas opener but Dr. Duck and Billy Campbell wouldn't be anywhere else. It's the Super Bowl of Duck Hunting and everyone is ready to hit the timber.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: The Realtree team meets up with Ole Miss friends Keith Carter and Ken Crain, as well as Mr. Doug from Pivotal Partners, for a Merriam's and Rio turkey hunt in northern Nebraska. The action is fast and furious. Day No. 1 brought three gobblers for team Carter/Crain. On day No. 2, the action stayed consistent and team Carter/Crain killed two more. Then, Brian Doughman from Realtree knocked down No. 6. It was another incredible hunt in the Keya Paha river valley.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Dr. Duck and Billy Campbell head north to the Dakotas to get a jump on the 2019 duck season with Ed McDonough and friends. Stale weather and too much water make field hunting a bust, but a cold front and a pothole covered in birds quickly changes the tempo and helps the crew ring in the new season in style.

But when a thieving organ grinder's (Harvey Keitel) monkey escapes, Eva bonds with a new friend. As much as she tries, Eva can't housebreak her new pet ... or break him of his training to steal. And Eva's getting the blame in this heartwarming family comedy.

programme.desc: A former superhero who has lost his powers is forced back into action to help turn a motley crew of kids into the next great world-savers.

programme.title: Apple of My Eye
programme.desc: When a riding accident causes a teenage equestrian to lose her eyesight, a miniature horse named Apple is trained to be her seeing eye companion.

programme.title: RV
programme.desc: In the spirit of bonding with his dysfunctional family, patriarch Bob rents a motorhome for what becomes a madcap road trip to the Colorado Rockies.

programme.title: The Next Karate Kid
programme.desc: A teenage girl struggles to balance the trials of high school, the discipline of martial arts, and the thrill of her first romance.

programme.title: 3 Ninjas Kick Back
programme.desc: After following their grandfather to Japan, the three young ninjas-in-training find themselves running from brain-dead thieves and an army of ninjas.

programme.title: Zoom
programme.desc: A former superhero who has lost his powers is forced back into action to help turn a motley crew of kids into the next great world-savers.

programme.title: The Perfect Holiday
programme.desc: Warm holiday tale about a single mom wishing for a loving man for Christmas. Soon, her daughter tells a mall Santa who tries to grant her Mom’s wish.

programme.title: Troop Beverly Hills
programme.desc: A wealthy socialite takes charge of her daughter’s wilderness troop and teaches the girls a series of unconventional survival skills.

programme.title: 3 Ninjas Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Rocky, Colt and Tum Tum take on a ruthless businessman whose waste management company has been illegally dumping toxic waste at an Indian reservation.

programme.title: 3 Ninjas: High Noon at Mega Mountain
programme.desc: Join the Ninja brothers for a rollercoaster ride of fun and action, as they witness the kidnapping of a TV superstar and strike back with a vengeance.

programme.title: Taking 5
programme.desc: Two nerdy teens fan-out to the extreme and plot to kidnap the world’s most famous boy band to make them play at their school and make them popular.

programme.title: North
programme.desc: After a judge allows him to sever ties to his work-obsessed parents, a boy embarks on an international quest for the quintessential set of parents.

programme.title: Bingo
programme.desc: A circus dog named Bingo becomes involved in a variety of adventures and misdemeanors, but that doesn't stop him from eventually making his way home!

programme.title: Baby Geniuses
programme.desc: When a scheming billionaire decides to steal the pre-language baby code to take over the world, the little tykes team up and fight back.

programme.title: Short Circuit
programme.desc: When a lovable mechanical marvel of a robot is accidentally electrocuted, he flees his lab and lands on a young girl’s doorstep, ready for adventure

programme.title: Fly Away Home
programme.desc: After Amy (Anna Paquin) loses her mother in a car accident, she must uproot her life and move to Canada to live with her father, Thomas, (Jeff Daniels), an oddball inventor with whom she has no relationship. She initially struggles to find her her place in her new home, but things change when she stumbles upon a collection of abandoned goose eggs. When the eggs hatch, Amy and her dad work together teaching the motherless birds to fly south for the winter, and their relationship blooms.

programme.title: Fail Safe
programme.desc: A malfunction inadvertently sends American planes armed with nuclear warheads to Russia in a blunder of potentially apocalyptic proportions.

programme.title: Three on a Couch
programme.desc: An artist hopes to move to Paris, but his psychiatrist fiancée fears abandoning her patients, so he dons various disguises to cure the lonesome women.

programme.title: No Sad Songs for Me
programme.desc: Upon being diagnosed with terminal cancer, selfless suburban housewife Mary Scott (Margaret Sullavan) makes the ultimate sacrifice: she decides to keep the unpleasant news from her husband, Brad (Wendell Corey), and daughter, Polly, to avoid devastating her loved ones. Instead, Mary encourages Brad's affair with a co-worker (Viveca Lindfors), and even grooms the other woman to take her place. But as Mary's illness progresses, keeping it a secret presents a considerable challenge.

programme.title: In the French Style
programme.desc: A young American travels to Paris to become an artist. Swept up in a series of affairs, she must decide whether to stay or return home to get married.

programme.title: The Trouble with Angels
programme.desc: A Reverend Mother faces an uphill battle to reform a pair of young, hard-to-reach troublemakers who’ve been wreaking havoc on her convent school.

programme.title: Rockin' in the Rockies
programme.desc: Shorty Williams (Moe Howard) is put in charge of his cousin's ranch, but he is more concerned with becoming a prospector. He comes across two drifters (Larry Fine, Curly Howard) who just got lucky at the roulette table and befriends them as possible investors. Shorty also meets singer Betty (Gladys Blake) and her partner (Mary Beth Hughes) and convinces them to stay on the ranch along with the vagrants. Unfortunately, Shorty's cousin, Rusty (Jay Kirby), returns early and isn't pleased.

programme.title: Love Affair
programme.desc: Jim Leonard, a penniless aviator and airplane mechanic, falls in love with the wealthy Carol Owen while giving her flying lessons.

programme.title: Gidget Grows Up
programme.desc: When her boyfriend leaves for the Air Force without calling, Gidget heads to New York in the name of world peace and joins the U.N. as a tour guide.

programme.title: You Belong to Me
programme.desc: Rich playboy Peter Kirk (Henry Fonda) crashes into Dr. Helen Hunt (Barbara Stanwyck) on a ski slope and overplays his injuries so she will continue her medical attention. He declares his love, and, although Helen insists that her career will always come first, the two get married. Soon, Peter is consumed by jealous suspicions of his wife's male patients and embarrasses Helen several times. Fearful of driving her away, Peter launches into character-changing behavior to prove his love.

programme.title: The Cockleshell Heroes
programme.desc: During World War II, feuding leaders train British recruits for a risky covert mission to blow up a giant battleship in an enemy-held French port.

programme.title: Miss Grant Takes Richmond
programme.desc: A bookie operating behind a real estate front gets pulled into the business for real when he hires a daffy secretary who thinks the office is legit.

programme.title: Hook, Line and Sinker
programme.desc: Diagnosed with a terminal illness, Peter decides to go out with a bang— racking up $100,000 in credit card debt—only to find he's not dying after all.

programme.title: A Raisin in the Sun
programme.desc: Sidney Poitier stars in this iconic version of the famous play about a cash poor family who start to fray when they inherit a life insurance payout.

programme.title: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner
programme.desc: A daughter visits her family to introduce them to her Black fiancé, whose kindness and loving demeanor changes the hearts of her reluctant parents.

programme.title: Our Wife
programme.desc: A composer (Melvyn Douglas) goes on a cruise and meets a woman (Ruth Hussey) he likes more than his wife (Ellen Drew).

programme.title: The War Lover
programme.desc: In England during World War II, a pair of bomber pilots fall for the same woman but only one will make it through the conflict to ask for her hand.

programme.title: The Swimmer
programme.desc: In a Connecticut suburb, Ned notices there are pools throughout the neighborhood and decides to "swim" home via the pools of his wealthy friends.

programme.title: Knock on Any Door
programme.desc: A young man, a product of skid row, accused of murdering a cop, is defended by a prominent attorney who has known him from childhood.

programme.title: The Ambushers
programme.desc: When an experimental flying saucer is brought down in Mexico, secret agent Matt Helm is sent to find it and keep it from falling into enemy hands.

programme.title: First Comes Courage
programme.desc: Beautiful Norwegian woman Nicole Larsen (Merle Oberon) is dedicated to the local resistance movement, and seduces Nazi officer Paul Dichter (Carl Esmond) in order to gain information that will help to defeat the Germans. Complicating matters for Nicole are both the difficulty of her loathsome undercover work and the appearance of an old flame, handsome English soldier Allan Lowell (Brian Aherne), who would like nothing more than to reunite with her.

programme.title: Walk, Don't Run
programme.desc: During the Olympics, an electronics expert learns his hotel room will not be available for two days, and is forced to share an apartment with a woman.

programme.title: Phffft!
programme.desc: A divorced couple hopes to move on after their split, but fate has other plans. They’re dating other people, but they keep running into each other!

programme.title: Under the Yum-Yum Tree
programme.desc: The machinations of a lusty landlord threaten the bliss of a couple trying to determine their character compatibility by living together platonically.

programme.title: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner
programme.desc: A daughter visits her family to introduce them to her Black fiancé, whose kindness and loving demeanor changes the hearts of her reluctant parents.

programme.title: They Came to Cordura
programme.desc: On a mission to Mexico, U.S. Maj. Tom Thorn (Gary Cooper) is branded a coward, while several of his fellow servicemen are praised for showing bravery. Tom is asked to transport the heroes through harsh terrain so they can be honored. Also along for the journey is Adelaide Geary (Rita Hayworth), a woman charged with conspiring against the United States. But, as his fellow soldiers begin revealing their treacherous sides, Tom realizes that Adelaide is the only heroic one of the bunch.

programme.title: The Man From Tumbleweeds
programme.desc: Ex-convict gunfighters join a state ranger (Bill Elliott) on patrol for outlaws.

programme.title: Cowboy
programme.desc: A Chicago hotel clerk smitten with the daughter of a trail boss’s business partner goes on a cattle drive with him to Mexico through the real West.

programme.title: The Quick Gun
programme.desc: A banished gunfighter (Audie Murphy) returns to his sweetheart (Merry Anders) and helps his sheriff friend (James Best) face outlaws.

programme.title: The Untamed Breed
programme.desc: Texas ranchers resist an out-of-towner (Sonny Tufts) who has a Brahman bull to breed.

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: Four soldiers of fortune are hired by a wealthy rancher to rescue his beautiful young wife who has been kidnapped by a villainous Mexican bandit. When they finally find her, after fighting their way across deserts and mountains, they discover she is not being held against her will. This causes friction within the band as to whether they should honor their agreement.

programme.title: The Stranger Wore a Gun
programme.desc: After the Civil War, a spy for the Confederacy absconds to Arizona to start a new life but gets reluctantly pulled into a stagecoach gold robbery.

programme.title: Riders of the Northwest Mounted
programme.desc: A Mountie (Russell Hayden) and his partner (Dub Taylor) set out on a manhunt.

programme.title: Gunmen From Laredo
programme.desc: A framed Texas rancher (Robert Knapp) escapes from prison for a showdown with a saloonkeeper (Walter Coy).

programme.title: The Violent Men
programme.desc: Former Union soldier John Parrish (Glenn Ford) wants to sell his ranch and start a new life by settling down out east. However, the ruthless tactics of Lew Wilkison (Edward G. Robinson), the scheming businessman interested in his property, make Parrish reconsider the move, especially after one of his ranch hands is murdered. Adding to the increasingly tense conflict is Wilkison's wife, Martha (Barbara Stanwyck), who is cheating on her husband with his brother, Cole (Brian Keith).

programme.title: The Guns of Fort Petticoat
programme.desc: Texan and U.S. Cavalryman Lt. programme.desc: The closing of what was once a very popular public garden in Midsomer Deverell sparks a series of murders that have Inspector Barnaby and Sgt. Troy stumped.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Following the funeral of local hotelier Karl Wainwright, his hotel's manager and a well liked Punch and Judy performer, Gregory Chambers, disappears unusually in yet another picturesque Midsomer village. programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A man's naked body found under mysterious circumstances, within a crop circle on Sir Harry Chatwyn's wheat field, leads police to investigating how he wound up in the field after being electrocuted. While the nearby village of Midsomer Parva is abuzz with UFO mania, Barnaby is unconvinced by a local ufologist that the man's death was the result of alien activity, as he uncovers rivalries, theft and hatred during his investigations, soon after a well known burglar is found dead in another crop circle with identical injuries.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Returning home one night, in a drunken state, the local doctor of Newton Magna calls in the police after he had accidentally hit a man, yet when Barnaby and Troy arrive, the injured man is nowhere to be found. programme.desc: When the curate of the local church in Midsomer Parva is burned alive in the effigy of the straw woman, DCI Tom Barnaby and DS Dan Scott find themselves investigating what must be a murder.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Exactly nine years after Ferdy Villers killed himself, his entire family reunites for Christmas unaware that someone is out for revenge.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The unveiling of a newly-discovered novel by deceased Midsomer crime-writer George Summersbee at the Luxton Deeping Crime Festival is jeopardised when the manuscript is stolen and a woman is fatally electrocuted by a booby-trapped roulette wheel. Can new dad Barnaby untangle a web of jealousy and obsession to find the killer?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a pub landlady is crushed to death during a magic show in Midsomer Oaks, Barnaby and Nelson uncover conflict between the village church and ancient pagan traditions. Is famous magician Gideon Latimer to blame or is he the target?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Could a ballad made famous by late, lamented folk singer Johnny Carver be an inspiration for murder? Did someone want to kill Toby Winning for threatening to take the Little Crosby Folk Festival away from Midsomer - or is the true motive something hidden for 20 years?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The fizz goes out of a sparkling wine launch when the glasses are laced with slug poison. Who is targeting the Midsomer Vinae Winery and what does the attack have to do with the death of a child in a hit-and-run accident?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As the Barnabys prepare for Cully's wedding, Lord Fitzroy and Beth Porteous are married in the pretty village of Bledlow. At the lavish reception at Bledlow Hall that follows, however, tragedy strikes - maid of honour Marina Fellowes is found murdered in one of the rooms by some of the guests. With their honeymoon cancelled, the Fitzroys must contend with a police presence in their home, as Barnaby and Jones try to learn more about the family history. It soon becomes clear there are secrets, deception, and an illegtimate son involved in the mystery, which is further complicated when the estate manager is killed by an arrow.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: It's a good day for the Hicks family, as the name of Tommy Hicks - who was executed during World War I for "cowardice and desertion" - is added to the list on Midsomer Parva's war memorial. Tommy's son Lionel and grandson Dave, mayor of Causton and whom Barnaby does not like (owing to dodgy building work by the mayor's company), are thrilled, but the snooty Hammonds are decidedly less pleased. Henry, the patriarch of the Hammond family, is particularly riled by his insalubrious neighbours, and has nurtured a long-running feud with the Hickses. But the evening after a battle re-enactment in the village, Henry is murdered - and Barnaby must delve into the history of the two families to find the killer, discovering a web of fraud, lies, and hidden truths.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones are in Dunstan to investigate the deaths of a reclusive couple. As they try to establish whether Ron and Libby Wilson were murdered or died of natural causes, their attention is drawn to a dispute raging between a local builder and road protesters nearby. When another death occurs, the detectives learn that there are plenty of dark secrets and fierce hostilities in this apparently idyllic village. Will Jack Purdy's quick temper lead to violence? How far would the protesters go to prevent the bypass being built? And do current events somehow relate to the death of Michael Wilson many years earlier?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When the body of Londoner Charlie Finleyson is discovered in woodland near Midsomer Sonning, Barnaby and Jones find themselves investigating employees at local Midsomer Life magazine. It turns out the dead man was married to the ex-wife of Guy Sandys, the wealthy owner of the publication. As the detectives become aware of a feud between Guy and the proprietor of the Morecroft Hotel, tensions are also heating up between the locals and visiting Londoners. Soon Barnaby and Jones find themselves to trying to piece together the truth about the murder, and learn that someone might be trying to conceal something in their past.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: It's Lamborghini versus everyone in Scottsdale, Ariz.; The World's Greatest Collector Car Auctions once again feature some of the most scintillating vehicles ever sold, including a Lamborghini Diablo owned by Danny Koker.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Fords, Pontiacs, Chevys, and Porsches go head to head as bidders go dollar for dollar trying to get the best deals on the finest vehicles in sunny Scottsdale, Ariz.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Roadsters, Superbirds, and Porsche 911s are the main attraction, but a Fast Attack Buggy from "Fast & Furious 7," a replica John Deere Tractor, a Little Gem Travel Trailer, and a Divco Custom Milk Truck are also sure to turn heads.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Among a bevy of beautiful vehicles being auctioned at no reserve are Simon Cowell's 1970 Triumph Spitfire MK III Convertible and John Mayer's 2006 Ford GT Heritage Edition!

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny sees something in his shop that makes him very uncomfortable, emptiness.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny and Kevin visit mad mechanic Gordon to see his latest insane creation. Meanwhile, Danny shakes the rust off a '34 Ford.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Like in the cartoons, the Plymouth Road Runner has always eluded Danny.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: The shop has its hands full restoring a 1942 Ford truck that needed a lot of TLC and a special touch for the owner's wife. Danny and Ryan check out a badass 1929 Ford Roadster.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny has a customer who wants to restore a 1942 Ford truck that saw some action in WWII. But when Danny takes in the project he quickly learns it'll need a lot more.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: A customer wants to trick out his 2004 Harley Davidson Road Glide, but both Shannon and Ryan aren't sure they can do everything he wants.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Kevin and the team come together to make something special for Danny. Meanwhile Danny runs into an old pal and his 1959 Corvette gasser.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Kevin is won over by a hotrod pick-up truck, Danny tracks down a customer's original 1969 Firebird but its terrible condition may make it impossible to restore.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny acquires a '62 Caddy which he hopes will be a huge flip. Ryan devises a secret plan for the car behind Danny's back, but when Danny finds out there's some explaining to do.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny tries to get the derailed '62 Caddy project back on track, while Ryan tries to make amends for a mishap by finding a flip or two for the shop.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny checks out a mind-blowing collection, which includes a 1933 Ford Roadster and a '53 Henry J. Meanwhile Kevin, Ryan and Mike make.

programme.desc: Ryan works on a secret project for chopper shop Bones Legacy, while a Chevy Impala that redefines "lowrider" blinds Mike and Roli.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny builds a world-class bike for a high end client, and if all goes well it could mean a ton of new business for the shop.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny continues his El Caminos love affair with a 1975 beauty.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny must do a full bumper-to-bumper restoration on a '66 Mustang convertible, but after stripping it down, he finds very little car between her bumpers; Danny must to decide between asking for more money or losing a bunch of his own.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny and the team continue wrestling with a stock restoration Mustang mess, hoping for extra funds and a lot of patience from their client; Kevin spots a rare old Grand Prix and Danny visits a world class specialist, looking for ideas.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Representatives from Sailor Jerry enlist the shop's help to build a bike to commemorate the late artist's iconic style and to auction off at an upcoming charity fundraiser.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: A high end client has his heart set on a tricked out '68 Camaro, so Danny sets out to find one and give it the world class Counts Kustoms treatment.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Shannon recruits the guys to help him finish up a gift for Danny, a bike he started building for him- ten years ago. Meanwhile, Danny spots a 1969 Corvette in a friend's lot.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny makes an old Ford Econoline look so cool that in the end, two buyers get into a bidding war for it. Danny can score big, but only if he can let his baby go.
